Name: Monopoly: Oostende
Description:
Ostend, the queen of seaside cities, the most beautiful on the Belgian coast, has its own Monopoly.

Historical sights are combined with modern architecture, art, culture and a lively atmosphere. 
Monopoly Oostende is the ideal way to (re)discover the city in a different way. 
Visit the Sint-Petrus-en-Pauluskerk, buy the stadium of KV Oostende, build a hotel on the seawall, take a walk on the picket fence or treat your friends during the Paulusfeesten.

This Monopoly edition takes you to all the beauty that Ostend has to offer. This unique edition is the must-have for every Ostend or Ostend enthusiast.

For the real collectors there is also the Limited Ensor Edition. Only 160 hand-numbered copies of this edition - in honor of 160 years of Ensor - are made. The box will have a unique sleeve with James Ensor's self-portrait and will contain 6 wooden pawns that are only available in this edition.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Ryder: The Card Game
Description:
A game where luck is cast aside in honour of memory, strategy and, after some time, skill. Set in the time of knights & wizards.

Battle your friends to earn the most tributes and buy your passage home.

Each player has 4 cards dealt to them, face down and takes it in turns to combat their foes around the table. You may look at your cards but cannot move the position of them. You select your cards to attack other players face down cards and then begin the process of endeavoring to remember where all the cards are, who to attack, what skills to play on opponents to mess with their gameplay etc.

Designed to remove the "Luck" element of card games and instead grant the winner victory via superior memory or strategic skills. With additional elements such as War Cry's and individual card skills, there's plenty to laugh about while playing.

–description from the designer

Name: UNO Bundle Collector Tin
Description:
What a great gift for your friends who love to play games: UNO, PHASE 10, and SNAPPY DRESSERS in one premium collectible tin! Which one will they play first?

UNO: Match colors and numbers to be the first to get rid of all your cards.

PHASE 10: Players must complete rummy like hands to move through all 10 phases of the game.

SNAPPY DRESSERS: the delightfully creative card game in which every card matches in one way with every other card in the deck. It's the ultimate game collection for super-fun nights in with family and friends. Gather your friends and play all three!

Three classic games for nights in with family and friends

–description from the publisher

Name: The Jester and the Minstrel (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
Description:
It’s fair time in the region of Carcassonne! Travelling minstrels, jesters, jugglers, musicians and magicians gather together to provide fun and festivities for the peasants. News of the fair is spread far and wide, with some of the entertainers travelling the nearby countryside to announce the fair’s whereabouts. Some of these travelling showmen perform song and dance for their onlookers; others provide a bit of tom foolery and distract peasants from their duties.
Expands the Catapult with two new followers: the jester and the minstrel.

Name: Lauschwunder
Description:
A memory game in which you don't have to find pairs of pictures but pairs of towers that sound the same. The towers are filled with material such as shells, pebbles, sand and much more.

The towers can also be filled with your own objects.

–user summary

Name: Cactus Town: The Lone Ranger
Description:
An expansion to Cactus Town introducing the solo mode & 5th player mode. It also introduces a new asymmetric party to Cactus Town: The Lone Ranger.

Commissioned by the Federal Marshal, his objective is to keep everyone in check until the Marshal’s task force arrives, not trusting anyone but himself. A new game mechanic based on round events will put a time-limit on your games, ending the game when the event deck is depleted and the Marshal arrives.

In the solo mode, you will take on the role of the Outlaws and experience a race against the clock to get your job of plundering done before the Marshal shows up… all the while the Lone Ranger will tamper with your plans, being your automata opponent.

In a 2-5-player game, you can take on the role of the Lone Ranger yourself, trying to prevent anyone else from fulfilling their objectives and manipulating events to win time and speed up the arrival of the Marshal. Note that the Lone Ranger is a necessary faction for any 5p games, since he puts a natural time limit on the game.

–description from the publisher

Name: Chinchiller Dice
Description:
Chinchiller Dice is a bluffing game of literal blind trust.

When it is your turn, you roll the two dice, trying to score as much sand from the general supply as possible. You may re-roll any die that has not landed special side up as often as you like. Sooner or later though you will roll two chinchillers and have to close an eye.

Once both your eyes are closed, you can not re-roll any dice any more when it is your turn again. Instead, your left neighbor will tell you what you have rolled after just one roll. Your neighbor will also be the one who will have to pay for any sand you are scoring while blind. As a result, there is a good chance your neighbor will try to cheat you. It will be up to you to either accept your neighbor's word blindly or to try to catch them in the act. However, if you are greedy while your neighbor is telling the truth, you will be the one losing precious sand.

—description from the publisher

Name: Tofu God
Description:
Tofu God is a party game of story snippets.

You will use cards showing silhouettes, mostly of animals, in an attempt to fill out the proverbial blanks you are dealt in the form of questions. Meanwhile, everybody else will try to intuit your answers and, more importantly, also which silhouettes you have chosen to represent them.

When it is your turn, you will answer one of two randomly drawn conundrums. To do this you will have eight of your ten silhouettes to pick from. For each of the three questions that make up your conundrum you will secretly decide on the best and the worst answer from your point of view. Question by question, everyone else will try to guess your favorite answer. Whenever someone is correct, both you and that player will get a point. However, if a player mistakenly thinks that your least favorite answer might be your favorite one, that player loses one point. The game ends when everyone has had the same amount of turns. If you manage to earn the most points, you win.

—description from the publisher

Name: Uphill
Description:
Uphill is set in Discrimi Nation, where he inhabitants fight an intense battle, in which the wind favors the Nobles in power, while the peasants are desperately trying to climb the social ladder.

Each player gets warriors at random.

The peasantry hands over its strongest warriors to the nobility, while in turn the nobility passes its weakest warriors to the peasantry. Sounds fair? Depends on who you ask.

After that, based on how strong their army is, each player has to guess how many battles they are going to win.
 Then the war begins: The King/Queen starts the game with placing a card on the table. Other players has to play a card with the same color. The stronger warrior hits the weaker (higher number hits the smaller one). The round is won by the player who played the highest card in the given color.

Based on the number of battles won, and how close were your guesses, power is redistributed, and ranks get swapped. You win some, you lose some.

And a new battle begins…

The player who can hold his/her Royal title 3 times in a row, wins the game.

Name: Guntia: schnick's dir !!!
Description:
In the game Guntia, you move your piece by rolling the dice on a map through the district of Günzburg to occupy free communities. You succeed in occupying a municipality if you win an extended Rock Paper Siccors (+2 more gestures) against your fellow players. Once a municipality is occupied, it may no longer be entered by other players, with the exception of the two municipalities in the centre. If a player has conquered 10 communities, or if a player cannot move for two rounds, the game is over. Points are awarded for occupied municipalities, as well as castles or coats of arms in the municipal area.

—user summary

Name: Pregame of Majority 2
Description:
Pregame of Majority 2 is a 2 player card game from Japan. It is a simplified version of the game The Majority 2

Welcome to the "Dark Council" in Nagatacho, the demon world! In this parliament, which is the center of the demon world, non-humans are still dying for their own benefit. And now, some have formed factions to gain a lot of money and power. Numbers is also power... If you gather like-minded friends, you may be able to dominate Congress. How powerful a faction can you create?

This game is a simplified version of The Majrity 2 with the theme of making factions. It is a two-player draft game played with three types of cards, and has simple rules and a unique play feeling that can be settled in five minutes. Enjoy a light game.
publisher's summary

Name: Kopparhavets kapare
Description:
In 1991, the expansion module "Kopparhavets kapare" came out for the Swedish role-playing game "Drakar och Demoner" and the module takes place in the Swedish fantasy world "Ereb Altor". Included in the expansion where rules for naval combat, which can be played together with the role-playing game or as a separate board game. 
You can play different peoples such as humans, "Svartfolk" (Greenskins), "Gråalver" (Sea elves), ducks etc. Why not have a sea mage on board who is a wind weaver. Participate in "Det felisiska piratkriget" (the Felician Pirate War). Enter or ram other ships in large naval battles. Fight against the black pirate ducks of the Copper sea. Or why not attack one of the greenskin's Kyrakher with galleys that ogres and trolls are rowing.

Name: Rail Barons of the World
Description:
Rail Barons of the World contains a new universal Rail Baron deck that can be used with any Railways of the World Series map as well as a solo mode for 7 Railways of the World Series maps - Eastern US, Mexico, Portugal, Nippon, Great Britain, Sweden, and Australia.

Each universal Rail Baron has a goal for the player to achieve to earn points while playing a Railways of the World Series map.

The new solo mode introduced into the Railways of the World Series adds new twists and challenges to 7 of the Railways of the World Series maps. The solo system was designed by Dávid Turczi & John Albertson.

—description from the publisher

Name: 民の見えざる手 (Invisible Hands)
Description:
æ°‘ã®è¦‹ãˆã–ã‚‹æ‰‹ (Invisible Hands) is a trick-taking card game from Japan.

The first king was a hero of the country and a man of great faith, but he died mad because he could not accept the overflowing voice of the people. The third king devoted all his energies to the development of the country and set up many enterprises, but the unprecedented heavy taxation caused the people to protest. The fourth king reduced taxes for the benefit of the people, but he failed to produce any results and was ridiculed as an ornament king. The fifth king finally became resentful, and instead of listening to the people, he brought great prosperity to the country by his own means, but he was called a tyrant by the people with whom he colluded, and was forced to leave his throne.

And the next king is about to be chosen from the candidates.
What do the people want from their next king?
Will they be able to live up to their hopes and show what it takes to be king?

This is a confrontational, unusual trick-taking game where you have to guess your own subject while trying to sabotage your rival's subject. It's a trick-taking game unlike anything you've seen before.
The game can be played by 3 or 4 players and there are also rules for 2 players.
publisher's summary

Name: Tank Throwdown
Description:
Tank Throwdown is a game of fierce tactical armored combat played with cards on any available surface. Customize the play area and compete to be the last one standing leaving your friend's tanks in smoking ruins. Play with up to 3 players using one deck or combine multiple decks so everyone can play!

Tank Throwdown plays similarly to a tabletop miniatures game but everything you need to play is in a single deck. Players use one card to represent their tank. Gameplay is handled by manipulating a small deck of action and response cards. Terrain and bonuses add variety to the play space. Games last from 5-20 minutes and can be set up almost anywhere there is a flat surface.

—description from the designer

Name: Yoru: The card game
Description:
Yoru is a chaotic and quick party card game. Players battle fiercely to get the eternal scrolls and win the match. In the game there are 5 ninja clans that hold the scrolls. Each clan has unique cards with different powers. Use the cards wisely and don't forget if you run out of cards, you lose the game.

At the beginning, all players receive 1 objective card at the beginning of the game. The player's objective card cannot remain in his hand, and must be turned over until the victory condition is reached. Then the main deck is shuffled and all players are dealt 5 cards. An objective card is face up. The player who has the most black pieces of clothing begins.

Players lose if they have no cards in their hand, or if they have more than 15 cards in their hand. The player wins if he has all the scrolls of the symbols on his objective card.

Name: Fan Fu Football
Description:
Fan Fu Football is the live action fantasy football card game designed to play along with live or recorded football games.

Fan Fu Football brings 1 - 4 players into direct fantasy competition at every kick-off. Football is a game of "Touchdowns" and "First downs". Our simple game mechanics grant our players drive by drive action without infringing on watching the game.

Turn on a game, deal 5 cards, and on kick-off put fantasy cards "In Play". Immediately redraw to a 5-card hand (draw after every card put in play).

On every subsequent first down, put more cards in play. The first "Drive" always begins with a kick-off and player also play on first downs, so each game usually starts with two plays, to start a "Drive". Stack your cards of the same position or diversify your position cards to get maximum points on each drive of the game. Star and Rookie cards can be played at any time and can perform different actions and bonuses, as well as score points.

A "Drive" ends with a punt, turn-over, field goal or touchdown. If a "Drive” ends with a punt or turnover, score the points for the cards in "In Play" and discard them. When a "Drive” ends with a field goal or touchdown, score the points for the cards in "In Play", discard them, as well as your hand, and draw a new hand. It's just that simple.

Pick up and play on certain drives, per quarter, half, or a whole game. The easy scoring system helps keep track of the score.

Are you a gamer who loves sports too?  This game was built by gamers and requires strategy. Gameplay is based on live events, guaranteeing each round of Fan Fu Football will be unique. Whether the game is high scoring or low scoring, the proper strategy will allow players to score fantasy points. Players can utilize both offensive and defensive cards during a drive, adding flexibility to strategic play.

From youth to professional, play fantasy football with any game, anytime.  The portability of Fan Fu Football makes it easy to take to a friends' house or to carry when traveling.  Great for game watching parties or family gatherings, combine multiple decks to add more players. You can also play a solo version, where you log your score for every solitary game and try to beat your high recorded score.

Fan Fu Football brings an extra level of fun and excitement to any game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Bom Lắc
Description:
A super ridiculous, stupid, nonsense game but extremely suprised and fun!

Roll a dice and see who is gonna exploded, the one standing still in the end is the winner.

With special ability cards, you can play up to 50 people!

—description from the back of box

Name: Tribu de Sinvergüenzas: Sigamos Pecando
Description:
New cards that will allow you to continue enjoying these gray times.

You don't need the first version to play this new edition of Tribe of Scoundrels.

Leave your shame at home.

Tribu de Sinvergüenzas: Sigamos Pecando is a drinking game in which you will face three types of challenges: Indictment, Social Defiance, and WTF Questions.

If you dare, you must accuse others, respond with truth, or share the challenge.

At game's end, the player with the most points is expelled from the tribe, while the player with the fewest is named Head of the Scoundrel Tribe and winner of this game.

–description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Dungeon Degenerates: Guttergeist
Description:
Guttergeist is a single Lowlands Monster, included with the second issue of the official Dungeon Degenerates zine: Die Wurst.

It has the following stats:
Name: Guttergeist
Class: Heretic * Weird
Value: 1 XP, 0 gold
Target: Lowest MAG
Attack: 2
Armor: 0
HP: 4
Abilities: Fear [black], Evade, Ghostly

Name: Tierdetektiv
Description:
Content: Inflatable Globe, 68 animal clue cards, hourglass, 1 die
The players roll the die and receive a clue to an animal from a clue card. A fellow player reads out the clue. Depending on the agreed level, the fellow player gives all or fewer clues.
The active player must now find the animal on the inflated globe within a given period of time in order to receive the clue card. The first player to collect 10 clue cards or one clue card from each of the 6 different colours (continents) wins the game.

Name: 英雄对决 (Hero Battle): Ultraman
Description:
A trading card game published by Chinese collectible card publisher Kayou.
In this game, players can use heros from Ultraman Universe or Marvel Universe to fight with the opponent.
At the start of the game, each player draw 9 cards and set 5 of them on the field, other 4 cards are their hand. In each turn, player should choose a card on the field to fight the opponent, the player who has 5 heroes defeated will lose the game.

Name: Silbury
Description:
Summer solstice is coming. ln order to celebrate the event, the county druids gather at the bottom of Silbury Hill to challenge each other in a big potion making tournament. Each of them is eager to show his knowledge, wisdom, and power to the great druid, who is the only judge of this competition. As tradition requires, only the winner will be entitled as the great druid disciple. Anything is fair for such an honour!

For thousands of years, a spirit has been watching over each clearing. Every spirit is represented by an animal that is engraved on the giant stones surrounding Silbury Hill. Although they protect the forest, they tolerate the presence of druids on solstice days. They are even used to help druids by giving them their power and favour, sometimes in exchange for an offering ...

Name: Kult Spiel: deutschsprachige Literatur
Description:
The players move their pieces across a playing field towards the goal by correctly answering questions about German-language literature. Each player can choose from 4 question cards, from the back of which he or she can already draw conclusions about the possible question. The player chooses a question card.

Then there are 4 possibilities: a) answer the question correctly with the announcement "Cult!" without any indication of the possible answers and move 3 spaces or b) first listen to the question and then answer correctly without any indication of the possible answers and move 2 spaces or c) listen to the question and the possible answers and answer correctly and move 1 space or d) answer the question incorrectly and stop.

The player who reaches the target field first wins.

—user summary

Name: Commerciale-City-Play
Description:
A Monopoly-like game in which players acquires shops, experiences events and answers quiz questions (16 picture cards) about famous buildings. The game does without the increases in value from houses and hotels.

—user summary

Name: Battle Cattle: Quest for the Holy Pail
Description:
64 page expansion book that requires Battle Cattle second edition to play.

This Battle Cattle: second edition miniatures rules expansion book will give you the ability to play Battle Cattle in a world of swords and sorcery. Not only will the role of Battle Cattle in medieval times be explained, but you will have weapons, armor, accessories and modifications applicable to the time period. Add to this the element of moo-gic items and spells, and Battle Cattle becomes a whole new game.

—description from the back of the book

Name: 宝石泥棒の予告状 (Houseki Dorobou no Yokokujou)
Description:
å®çŸ³æ³¥æ£’ã®äºˆå‘ŠçŠ¶ (Houseki Dorobou no Yokokujou) is a game from Japan, meaning something like 'The Jewel Thief's Letter of Warning'. Originally produced in 2007, it was re-issued at the Tokyo Game Market in 2015.

This a trick-taking game but players don't have to -and may not want to- follow the colour (suit) lead. The cards show one, two or three colours each, and a player will receive a penalty chip for any color on their card which does follow the colour led.

The 40 card deck shows various aristocrats with their jewellery. The cards are ranked by number, and the 10 card is also a zero. Cards also show types of jewels in different clusters. The players are jewel thieves, trying to force their opponents into releasing valuable loot.

The designer says the unique scoring system can help a player overcome a bad hand.
user summary

Name: Cactus Town: The Lost Chief
Description:
This expansion introduces an all-new gameplay feeling to Cactus Town: the search for the LOST CHIEF.

Dakota will pay the town a visit in search of her father, so the party starts with one standee and (hopefully) gains a second. The player’s available actions change depending on whether Dakota is alone or reunited with her father. All the while they try to teach the townsfolk a lesson not to get involved with a Native American princess and her erstwhile peaceful tribe.

The expansion opens up new party combination options and adds yet another unique experience to how the game plays out.

—description from the publisher

Name: Stress Botics: Odyssey
Description:
Stress Botics Odyssey expands the heavy eurogame experience in 5 axes, while maintaining the basic rules and rhythm of the base game.

The first enhanced axis is the main room (the room where Alpha Bot currently is). Odyssey’s alternate board contains a zoom of the main room, and thus players will have to take into account their positioning, in order to fight against the cylindroids and defend Alpha Bot from them. If Alpha Bot does not reach the surface, deliveries to ships will be much more complex to execute!

The second enhanced axis are the Cylindroids. When the players eliminate an entire wave of enemies, a Cylindroid Elite will appear. This powerful enemy is Alpha Bot’s nemesis, and boasts its own AI and complex behaviour.

The third enhanced axis is Alpha Bot. Beta Bots will be able to access the interior of Alpha Bot through a new type of action. Once inside they will be able to control Alpha Bot's AI in order to speed up its behavior, change its direction to crush enemies or avoid obstacles, repair shields, collect resources or equip objects, among many other things. However, players will have to be cautious when interacting with AlphaBot... If it receives damage while being controlled, it will activate its other temperamental AI revealing one of its multiple aggressive behaviors, such as going back to an already explored main room or indiscriminately attacking any robot next to it!

The fourth enhanced axis is the Solo Mode. By adding Delta Bot, a small robot that will accompany us to fulfill our objectives, adventurous players can play the game on their own. Odyssey includes an additional board to be affixed to the player's blueprint in order to expand management during the maintenance phases, as well taking care of Delta Bot. If the little companion accumulates too much stress it will explode, making the game much harder for the solo player.

The fifth enhanced axis is additional content. Odyssey adds more items to the current sets, including a new type of item: the boxed items.  Those can be dynamically equipped from the main room to be used more immediately, adding a touch of improvisation both to combat and to the strategies that structure the game. In addition, Odyssey includes modular boards that expand the detail of several mechanics and include unique characteristics in each player count.

Name: Cactus Town: Stampede
Description:
This expansion introduces another new asymmetric party to Cactus Town: The Cowboys and their herd of cows.

In the mix of Spaghetti Western parties, the cowboys don't want to stay behind. And they are not alone, they have brought their cattle with them. This is the craziest of all factions, the cowboys need to steer their herd through Cactus Town, guiding the lifestock to the cattle train waiting at the other side of town.

On their way, the herd will create stampedes, with the cows taking on anyone who stands in their way. Chain reactions are possible and no one is safe from the beasts. But then again, maybe you don't want to, because their movement effect might help you in your own objectives.

—description from the publisher

Name: Mini Express: Map Pack 1 – Taiwan & United Kingdom
Description:
Mini Express Map Pack 1 - Taiwan & United Kingdom contains a double-sided game board with new and challenging rules for Mini Express.

You conquered the Wild West.

You conquered the Old World.

Now, your dreams of steel and steam draw you across the ocean where new challenges and opportunities await you.

1908 Taiwan

It is the dawn of the 20th century. From 1895 to 1945, Taiwan was colonized by Japan. In that time, Japan heavily invested in modernizing Taiwan’s railway system around the island, with bold plans including building tunnels and tracks through mountains. In the Taiwan map for Mini Express, the white company represents Japan. Players are seeking to expand tracks across the island, especially to the 6 major cities; however, mountains pose a logistical problem. Players can at any time invest in Japanese modernization, and it indeed comes with benefits. However, the more players do business with Japan, the tighter the restrictions are in the game. Soon, you might find your influence in a company reduced to nothing if you’re not careful. Fulfill your dreams of steel and steam! Welcome to Taiwan! åŠ æ²¹ï¼

1918 United Kingdom

The Great War has finally ended, and the UK won. The economy of the United Kingdom is exploding with opportunity. Ferries to other countries are being negotiated. Harder, better, faster locomotives are being built. Construction of the London Underground begins to flourish. And rumors float about that Parliament will unite and condense the various railways across Great Britain into only a few. Opportunity awaits you in this bull economy, but can you build your railroad empire in time?

Extend the reach of your railroad empire across the globe in Mini Express Map Pack 1.

Name: KuruKuru Kitchen
Description:
KuriKuri Kitchen is a game from Japan. Originally published in 2008 it was re-issued at the Tokyo Game Market in 2015.

The players are cooks in a kitchen putting meals together. There are head chefs that move about on a simple rondel of numbers. The value of the head chef aids the players. The cooks are melding card sets in the style of Mahjong and Rummy. When a player discards a card, that moves a chef around the rondel. The player can use the number of the chef to help complete a meld. 
user summary

Name: Mineral Exploration
Description:
It is your responsibility to find new mineral deposits. This job requires that you be alert with all your senses, that you use the latest technology and that you make good decisions.
Make sure they are economically, socially and environmentally viable!

In Mining Exploration your mission is to explore the terrain using your exploration cards. Each terrain must be explored with an appropriate action to earn its points. The player with the highest score at the end of the deck will win the game. The standard version of the game is recommended for people 10 years and older. For players with more experience, it has a section with extensions to the rules which will add more options to the games and an advanced version of the game.
Card game designed for the Explorations Corporate Management of CODELCO (National Copper Corporation of Chile). It was distributed to children in schools in the company influence territory. The objective is to teach the work of mining exploration and basic concepts of geology and mining.

—description from the designer

Name: 魔幻特攻 (Magic Special Attack)
Description:
é­”å¹»ç‰¹æ”», roughly translated as "Magic Special Attack", is a two player game where the players compete to score the most points.

The players are illusionists erecting barriers in an arena of limited space.  When a player erects a barrier, they earn a gem of that color.  In lieu of placing a normal barrier on their turn, a player may also pay a gem to place a special barrier of the corresponding color.

If through either type a barrier placement a player creates a 1x1 isolated space, they may earn a bonus gem.

One round ends when one of the players cannot place an additional barrier. The game lasts over four rounds and points are awarded for earning a certain number of gems of each color and for sets of gems.  The player with the most points wins.

The game was originally released as part of the 2021 150BG.con convention in Taiwan, where games sell for 150 TWD, roughly $5 USD.

Name: Hungry Cells
Description:
Hungry Cells
Cells are the basic unit of life and of course, they have a lot of work to do! They are responsible for living beings to grow, breathe, walk, think and dream ... For this they need a large amount of energy and nutrients. In Hungry Cells you will know these nutrients and you will feed your favorite cell!
In Hungry Cells the players adopt the role of a cell, they must acquire the 6 nutrients that a cell needs to survive, the first cell to get them wins the game, but be careful! One cell may rob another of the nutrient already close to it.
Designed to teach the chemistry of food. It was the centerpiece of the annual booklet of the Science Week activities 2011, conducted by the EXPLORA CONICYT program (National Commission for Scientific and Technological Research) of the Ministry of Education of the Government of Chile. Hungry Cells was distributed along with the newspaper “La Tercera” throughout the country. Players had to craft the game with the central pages of the booklet.

—description from the designer

Name: Last Aurora: Player vs. Player
Description:
The enemies of your enemies... are still your enemies!

This module allows players to fight each other during the game!

Name: Last Aurora: Promo Card Pack
Description:
Do you need a new vehicle?
A crazy big weapon?
Or helpful Survivors?
No problem!

This module includes new additional cards you can add to the Exploration deck.

Name: Last Aurora: Role Cards
Description:
Survival in these frozen lands requires a lot more than luck. You’re going to call upon every skill and trick you know if you’re going to make it through.

This module includes Role cards you can add to your games to provide asymmetrical gameplay!

Name: Karukinka
Description:
Strange signs appear in the forest. Snow and frost show up earlier than expected. Why is summer coming to an end so soon? Venture out to investigate what is happening in the Karukinka Forest Boilers while escaping fearsome predators and saving resources to survive the harsh winter ahead.

In Karukinka, players take on the role of one of the squirrels in the Karukinka Forest. They must go through a first phase of the game, the warm phase, looking for seeds that allow them both to save  and to acquire equipment, while facing predators. Then in the second phase of the game, the cold phase, they must face both the predators and the Winter Wraiths with the equipment they acquired and the savings they have collected. The game ends when the Winter Wraiths are defeated and the Boilers in the forest are reignited.

Karukinka was designed for the Financial Education Department of the Social Investment and Solidarity Fund (FOSIS) of the Ministry of Social Development of the Government of Chile. Its use was initially implemented in schools in five regions throughout Chile. Within the framework of a campaign to strengthen the value of savings in 14-15 years aged children. The game is widely appreciated by teachers and students. There have also been tournaments at the national level.

Karukinka mean “our land” in Selknam language, one of the indigenous people of Chile.

—description from the designer

Name: The Great Race: Expansion 2
Description: This expansion provides greater depth for the game, encouraging campaign play and continental competitions. Plus, it contains an excellent solo mode which takes advantage of this "legacy" to create a deeper challenger for your "Me against the Game" experience.

Name: Rust: The AfterWorld
Description:
RUST : THE AFTERWORLD (abbreviated RTA) is an innovative card game created by Daniele Visentin & Max Pietricola and published by The AfterWorld Company, whose first Limited Edition has been fully funded via Kickstarter in April 2019 (with one of the most successful campaigns run that same year by an Italian team) and then again in 2021 for its 2nd Print Run.

After a long work of research and development - plus an extensive testing process - our creative team gave birth to a completely new kind of card game: a totally immersive experience with RPG's elements, supercool artworks by world-famous artists (like John Avon, Paolo Parente, R. K. Ferguson, Drew Tucker and many others), innovative mechanics and a sophisticated game system about survival. And it's unbelievably fun to play!

RTA is set in a near future, a prophetic future. A future in which the world has been devastated by a terrible Total War. And from the ashes of war a dreadful disease spread out, a plague which affects both men and machines: it is called the RUST.

In this rotten, shattered world, humanity has been decimated... and the survivors have gathered into 4 factions, to the four corners of the Earth, fighting each others for survival.

Among the survivors, there are some chosen ones, a few special individuals who seem to be immune to the plague and who soon become heroes for their peoples.

They are called: the Masters. And you, as a player, will be one of them!

... description from the official website (www.rusttheafterworld.com)

Name: World of Warcraft Trading Card Game: Shadowfang Keep Dungeon Deck
Description: Players can form a party of three to take on Lord Godfrey and the cursed denizens of Shadowfang Keep cooperatively. Unlike previous raid decks of World of Warcraft: Trading Card Game, you don't need a pilot for a Dungeon Deck, the deck plays itself by a built-in AI. You can also customize the Dungeon Deck for difficulty and your heroes will level up as you gain experience.

Name: Irr-elephant
Description:
Irr-elephant is finally here; the premier elephant stacking wooden game!

First, stack up the elephants higher and higher on progressively more precarious perches. Then, once you've completed your teetering tower, roll the die, and remove an elephant whose color matches the die. But be careful, if the elephants come crashing down, you lose!

—description from the publisher

Name: Crimes & Capers: Lady Leona's Last Wishes
Description:
It's 1919 at the Langford Estate. Lady Leona has died and absolutely no one is sad about it. She was forever threatening to write people out of her will. Now that she is finally gone, her closest family and favored servants have gathered for the reading of her will — but Leona always loved two things:  puzzles and making life difficult.

Crimes & Capers: Lady Leona's Last Wishes is a co-operative game in which you and a group of friends take on the roles of polished high society folks and hard-working servants who need to collaborate to solve the mystery and find Leona's treasure. No special skills or prior knowledge are required. Read the notes, figure out puzzles, and unlock the answers to find out where Leona hid her fortune!

—description from the publisher

Name: 即売会! (Sokubaikai!)
Description:
å³å£²ä¼š! (Sokubaikai!) is a co-operative card game from Japan. It's a two-day spot sale, and the players want to clean up and grab all those bargains. The goal is to clear all their hands of all cards before the game ends. If any player is left holding a card at the end of the game, they all lose.

The game has a deck of 48 cards numbered 1-48. The cards are in sections each with their own theme, 1-9 (Kitakuba), 10-19 (butterflies), 20-29 (eyeglasses), 30-39 (yokai), 40-48 (fanzines).

The deck is shuffled and seven cards are dealt out face-down to each player. Players sort their hand and then choose a hand card, placing it face-down. Once everyone has chosen, they reveal their card, and the lowest card is placed first in the centre (onto an imaginary zero), and then the next card and so on (similar to Take 5. Cards are played into a pile, and lower cards are hidden and not to be examined later.

Then each player draws a card so their hand is back to seven, and play continues in the same way.

At any point, even at the start, a player can call for a trade, and all players pass a card to the left. Successive trades can be made in the same round, but only six trades are allowed in the whole game. A marker is moved along a track on the rear of the game box to count the trades.

Discussion is allowed in the game, but is limited. Players cannot say or imply a specific numbered card, but can talk in general about their cards. For example, 'I have two 20s', or 'I have zero Kitakuba'. In this way, players can work out which cards would be good to trade or keep in hand.

If a player cannot play a card to the pile legally, the first day of sales ends and the pile is set to one side. Play continues for a second day, starting at zero again. If a player cannot play legally again, day two ends and the players all lose.

If the players succeed in clearing their entire hands before day two ends, they all win.

(Note: this game was published in Japan in 2016, before The Mind in 2018).
user summary

Name: Hybris: Divine Betrayal
Description:
An expansion for Hybris: Disordered Cosmos

The Divine Betrayal expansion includes:

1 Rulebook
    1 new playable God + Board & Miniature (Hermes)
    1 new Location board (the Tartarus)
    1 Chronos board for the Solo & Coop mode
    12 Standees
    1 Aid card
    231 mini Cards (Prisoners, new Heroes, new Primordial, Corruption, Conflict, Solo & Coop mode)
    49 tokens (Chain, Location, God, Marker)
    8 Enhancement tiles
    10 Spark cubes
    3 Temples

And more!

Name: Hybris: Cataclysm
Description:
An expansion for Hybris: Disordered Cosmos

The Cataclysm box includes:

1 new playable God + Board & Miniature (Artemis)
    1 new Location board (the Outer Limits)
    4 Hangar boards
    5 MK Tiles
    25 big Cards (Exploration, Game Aid)
    56 mini Cards (Conflict, Cataclysm)
    6 Enhancement tiles
    7 Standees
    10 Spark cubes
    21 tokens (Location, God, Marker)
    1 Aid card
    3 Temples

And more!

Name: Hybris: Love & Hate
Description:
An expansion for Hybris: Disordered Cosmos

The Love & Hate expansion includes:

2 new playable God + Board & Miniature (Aphrodite, Ares)
    36 Conflict cards
    12 Enhancement tiles
    14 Standees
    20 Spark cubes
    42 tokens (Location, God, Marker)
    2 Aid card
    6 Temples

And more!

Name: Hybris: Apollo
Description: An expansion for Hybris: Disordered Cosmos containing a new god.

Name: Name: The Celebrity Guessing Game
Description: Test your knowledge of well-known characters, actors, and celebrities, with the new Game Box - Name card game.  Teams work together against the clock in this fast-paced guessing game, giving clues to find the answers, but there are some clues you MUST NOT use!

Name: Werewolf Execution
Description:
“When the moon is full, the werewolves begin to find their prey. When the sun is on, the villagers will start executions…”

Players on each side Villager or Werewolf try to win against the other side. Not like any board game hidden role,  play/draw mechanism is used in Werewolf Execution to help players to interact, find information as well as increase vote to each other. Whoever reaches the full 7 votes or at the end of the day, the one who has the most votes, will be executed -  be eliminated from the game.

Werewolf Execution does not need a moderator and can be played from 5 people up. Not only the main roles: Werewolf and Villager, there are 2 more roles - Angle and traitor to increase the difficulty and the interest of the game.

—description from the back of box

Name: Rommel's Best!
Description:
This is a variant of ã€ŒGuderian's Best.ver3.0ã€

Solitaire tank simulation board game.
I aim at surviving while it being the fight car head of the tank corps under the Erwin Rommel conduct as for you during a period from 1941 through 1943, and fighting against the military unit of the British military.
"The command of the air" and "temperature" added the element of "the sandstorm" to the game system newly after having followed ã€ŒGuderian’s Bestã€ of Mr. Nigel Hodge.

Name: Fulda liebenswert-lebenswert ...spielend kennenlernen
Description:
The players roll the die and move their game piece along a given path through the German municipality of Fulda. They can collect victory points (5, 10, 15 or 20) at specially marked squares. To reach these fields, you may also move backwards. The first player to reach the target field with at least 500 victory points wins.

—user summary

Name: Gatekeeper
Description:
Gatekeeper is an intense 2-player cardgame that has you pitched against an opponent in a duel. In four locations you will position witches out of your hand and attempt to take control in small and larger scale confrontations, with the mysterious Gatekeeper playing a merciless referee using some unique dynamic mechanics.

When positioning a witch of a specific element at a location, columns are formed. A new witch will compare her spellpower with that of the opposing witch, with the higher value "dazzling" the weaker party. In dazzled state, witches are vulnerable for the vicious Gatekeeper that is now activated by the Gatekeeper value on the last played witch, moving X-number of locations in a set cycle movement. In the location she lands in, she will check if a dazzled witch is present and eliminate her from the contest.

Next, she will activate a rondel and move a marker to the next position, activating the next Element Gate in line.
By activating the gate she awakens all the witches of this element present at the location, triggering a larger scale confrontation, with the player holding majority inflicting damage equal to the number of withes they have present. The defending player can however fend off part of the attack with opposing witches.

Each witch also cast 1 of 10 unique special spells, each manipulating parts of the duel in devious ways. This additional layer creates tough decisions in an already challenging duel of wits.

Will you control the Astral plane by lowering the mana level of your opponent to "0"?

—description from the publisher

Name: Super Kontakt
Description:
The game aims to illustrate the performance characteristics of a 20th century Siemens "EMS" programmed telephone. The players are to move their 6 game pieces in turn to target fields by rolling the dice.  Before the sixth playing piece may enter a target field, all so-called "contact chips" must be used up. In order to gain certain advantages in the course of the game, the players must collect cards with features of the telephone on predefined fields. These are, for example, the right to enter a target field, to hand over more contact chips, to enter occupied fields, etc.
The first player to hand in all contact chips and move their 6th piece to a target field wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Kung-Fu
Description:
Kung-Fu is played on a 10*9 field. Each player has 3 pieces, 1 great master (Shihan) and 2 fighters (Bujin), which he places on his baseline.

Players move their pieces alternately and have to allocate 2 movement points to their pieces.  On squares that the pieces leave, they leave obstacle stones (Ate, 30 pieces). These can be jumped over if the square behind them is free. 3 special obstacle stones (Geri) prevent them from being jumped over.

There are 3 ways to win the battle, a) move your own Shihan to the opponent's baseline or b) capture the opponent's Shihan or c) capture the opponent's Bujin and immobilise the opponent's Shihan. Any other result is considered a stalemate.

—user summary

Name: Legends of Sleepy Hollow: The Ghost of Tarry Town
Description: This expansion includes two bonus standalone chapters for Legends of Sleepy Hollow, with new epic relic and skills upgrade cards and chits. Plus advanced difficulty game mats for all the chapters in the base game.
Families: Books: The Legend of Sleepy Hollow

Name: The Dwarves: Goimgar Character Pack
Description:
Additional hero for the game The Dwarves.

"Goïmgar Glitterbeard was quite lanky, only about half as wide as the two twins Boïndil Twoblade and Boëndal Pinnhand, and even much more petite than most of the others of his tribe, which was unusual for a dwarf. Goïmgar's curly beard hung full of diamond dust that had collected in his hair when he cut the gems. It looked as if he had trapped thousands of tiny stars in his beard."

In the The Dwarves Big Box is already enough space for the two new characters Djerun and Goimgar. You will then have 14 different miniatures to choose from.

Name: The Dwarves: Djerun Character Pack
Description:
Additional hero for the game The Dwarves.

„Djerun is, like all acronta, able to let his eyes flash up in a violet light, which will terrify almost all kinds of creatures. He is wearing an armour made of tionium (tionium is a black metal). His helmet’s visor resembles a grotesque demon’s face. Djerun is carrying a club, an axe, a sword and a serrated shield.“

In the The Dwarves Big Box is already enough space for the two new characters Djerun and Goimgar. You will then have 14 different miniatures to choose from.

Name: Maracaibo: The Uprising
Description:
The first big expansion of Maracaibo features several modules and scenarios, e.g. pushing the predominant nations out of the Caribbean (in competitive or cooperative mode). Other elements are asymmetrical player abilities, a new optional stories and legacy tiles as well as new project cards. Solo fans will encounter a new rival ("Jacque").

—description from the publisher

Name: Staatsmann
Description:
The players have to start from point zero after a war in order to get their country's economy going again.

To do this, they can disband existing armies (but lose power) in order to improve education, nutrition, raw material supply and consumer goods industries. Negotiations with the opposing countries, non-aggression pacts and lots of events as well as a variety of dice results control the course of the game.

The balance of power represented by armies (heavy metal chips) and thus decision-making powers is measured on a weight scale.

Two of the participating countries are so-called crisis countries, which have even worse starting conditions. They can also be played as non-player countries.

The player who leads his country to prosperity in the most economic sectors wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Final Fusion
Description:
Mix two unique factions and lead them through a constant conflict in a tight space. Colonize, upgrade and dominate to be the first to perform Final Fusion.

Final Fusion is a 2-4 (5 with expansion) player competitive game where you become a villainous commander in charge of two unique factions. To win you must perform a Final Fusion - an action that leaves you vulnerable unless you gather Void Particles first. Wait too long, and see other players win the game.

     Constant conflict from the first round
     Unique victory condition, not another point salad
     Elaborate alien miniatures, not another bags of spacecrafts
     Beautiful locations instead of balls floating in space
     28 Starting Faction Combinations (66 with expansion)


Short description of Gameplay
Final Fusion is a 2-5 players 60-90m conflict-driven space game, where each player leads an alliance of two alien races. Both races contribute a set of unique cards (used for actions and conflict resolution) and their Fleet (represented by a miniature with a functional tray to put your armies on).

From the first turn of the game, you partake in a “Fistfight in a space elevator” of a kind. All around you’ll have bloodthirsty neighbors waiting to strike. It is crucial to pick your battles and keep tabs on opponents - to know when to push back and when to tactically retreat.
The aim of the game is to achieve the eponymous Final Fusion, a feat of cosmic engineering on par with building a death star. This task requires getting Void Particles (VP for short), either by extracting them, colonizing locations, or dominating your opponents. While at it players strategically buy new technologies for their decks, gain Traits, and man their fleets to prepare for massive space battles.

Beware! The more VP you have, the easier it is to complete Final Fusion, but if you wait too long, another player might initiate the Fusion before you!

—description from the designer

Name: Socially Twisted: Party Game
Description:
Socially Twisted is the party game for bad people with good humor. Create a twisted story and get competitive with your friends or family. It’s a quick, funny, wacky, icebreaker, guaranteed to leave everyone cracking up!

Players are dealt story cards and word cards and must craft a storyline within 60 seconds. Then everyone votes for the most twisted story told.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Isle of Cats: Kittens + Beasts
Description:
The Isle of Cats: Kittens + Beasts is an expansion for The Isle of Cats adding 3 new expansion modules to the game. It also adds a new lesson module (I) to the game and 6 new family cards.

Each of the 3 expansion modules can be used independently with The Isle of Cats or combined in any way you wish.

Kitten module
Complexity: Easy
Compatible with: Standard mode, solo mode, family mode, and up to 6-players
The Kitten module adds more importance on being the fastest player each day and introduces new options in the form of kittens, without adding much complexity to the game.

Beast module
Complexity: Medium
Compatible with: Standard mode, solo mode, family mode, and up to 6-players
The Beast module adds ancient beasts to the game which provide early game goals while you search for lesson cards. Each beast will only be happy if it is near its friends and you will need to carefully position cat families around these creatures if they are to form friendships and score points.

Event module
Complexity: Hard
Compatible with: Standard mode, solo mode, and up to 6-players
The event module adds rule changing events to rounds 1 and 5, and ways to score points to rounds 2, 3, and 4. This provides another layer of challenge as you will need to adjust your strategies each round, and plan how to best use the rule changes to your advantage.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Isle of Cats: Boat Pack
Description:
The Isle of Cats: Boat Pack is an expansion for The Isle of Cats adding new boat boards to the game.

The Boat Pack expansion introduces 6 new boats, all of which have unique shapes and new layouts. Whether you are playing the standard, family, or solo mode, these new boats will require you to re-evaluate your options, come up with new strategies, and find new ways to fit cats, kittens, and beasts onto your boat.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Isle of Cats: Kickstarter Pack 2
Description:
The Isle of Cats 2021 Kickstarter Pack 2 upgrades the Kittens + Beasts expansion with larger beast meeples, and adds new cats, beasts & events to the game.

- Oshax kittens
  - 25 large wooden beast meeples
  - Special rescue cards
  - More lesson cards
  - More cat tiles
  - More beast tiles
  - More event tiles

Name: Let's PLAAY Jai-Alai
Description:
Let's PLAAY Jai-Alai re-creates the experience of hanging out at a jai-alai fronton in Connecticut, Florida or Las Vegas in the 1970s and can be played in any one of multiple game modes. There's the solo betting mode, where it's just you and your wagering savvy matching wits with tonight's card. Or, get friends together and make a night of it, each making your own bets to see who's the top dog. Nobody available tonight? You can still make it a party, matching wits with one or more of our card stock fronton-fans, who will place their own bets as you place yours. Or, you can skip the betting entirely and create your own professional jai-alai tour with a regular season, playoffs and a league champion!

—description from the publisher

Name: Chamuyo: A full!
Description: Chamuyo is a storytelling game in which you have to convince the judge by looking for your best arguments defending an association of letters. You are going to have to use your best chamuyo (chatter), so that the judge gives the points to you. If you don't win for best chamuyo, maybe you will earn points for rowing it!

Name: Chamuyo: De una!
Description: Chamuyo is a storytelling game in which you have to convince the judge by looking for your best arguments defending an association of letters. You are going to have to use your best chamuyo (chatter), so that the judge gives the points to you. If you don't win for best chamuyo, maybe you will earn points for rowing it!

Name: Cape May: Vocations Mini-Expansion
Description:
As you begin your development of Cape May, choose your vocation from two randomly dealt cards. Activate this once-per-game benefit to maximize your wealth and build prestige as the most successful developer in Cape May!

This promo pack contains ten Vocation cards and one rule card.

It also contains a bonus Event card, titled;

P.01 Fifty-Eight Foot Elephant Tower Erected.
All players may take an additional action this round.

This twelve card pack was originally given away to pre-order customers from the publisher Thunderworks directly.
Later available as part of the Game Boy Geek Season 10 Kickstarter.

Name: Valor & Villainy: Antagonist's Arsenal
Description:
Some like to work together with their friends to fight against a terrible villain. Others like to be that villain and roast their friends into smoldering piles of ash. Whichever way you want to slice it, the Antagonist’s Arsenal has you covered, adding all the component’s you’ll need to play co-op against Mordak, or to take control of the 5 Villains from Lludwik’s Labyrinth and play them 1 vs Many!

This is an expansion which can be added to any Valor & Villainy game. It requires you own either Lludwik's Labyrinth or Minions of Mordak to use.

—description from the publisher

Name: Monopoly: Ottignies-Louvain-la-Neuve
Description:
Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of the city of Ottignies-Louvain-la-Neuve, in Belgium.

Name: Five Leagues From The Borderlands: 2nd Edition
Description:
Welcome to the edge of civilization, where brigands rule and where the shadows are long. In tiny villages, people huddle in fear as terrors prowl the night. Out here, your word is as good as your sword and nobody will miss you.

Five Leagues From the Borderlands is a set of solo miniatures rules for fantasy campaign games. Taking inspiration from gritty "medieval-fantasy" like The Black Company and Harn, this is a world of brutal combat and ever-present danger.

The new version has been polished and improved, tidying up the rules, getting rid of excessive dice rolling and improving the pacing of the campaign game. In addition we’ve added:

Difficulty settings for players who want more or less challenge.
An Unusual background table for your characters.
Monsters from ogres to dragons. And a random monster generator.
Village events.
Encounters are far more varied: Enemy strengths and flaws, leadership figures, unusual battle conditions (from fighting in the rain to haunted terrain) and each type of Threat now has its own unique encounter table.
Many enemies also have special rules now, to make them more unique.
Multiple options for tailoring a long term campaign, such as “new game plus” options and large-scale campaign events such as holy crusades, rat-men invasions or the literal end of days!
New items to find, including magical weapons, potions and scrolls.
And much MUCH more.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Five Leagues From the Borderland

Name: Monopoly: Arlon
Description:
The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of the city of Arlon, in Belgium.

Administrative town where all the ministries are represented, military town housing an infantry school, educational center which welcomes many students from neighboring countries, cultural, commercial and industrial center, Arlon has also become a sought-after accommodation center. 
With a certain charm, the pretty city combines traditions, folklore and leisure activities in a quality environment. Think of the essential Maitrank festivals

– partial translated description from back of box

Name: Age of Musket: Shako and Musket 1854-1856 – Rules for scaled battles of the Crimean War
Description:
These rules are part of a series that cover the era of the Musket (1690's - mid 19th century).
The rules of Shako and Musket 1854-1856 are designed to capture the flavour of this specific war with the subtle changes and nuances.
They are designer to be easy to use, fast flowing and capable of covering small and large games.

Sequence of play:
1- Declare Charges
2- Charge response check
3- Charge reaction  movements
4- Melee resolution
5- Breakthrough check (for charging units)
6- Breakthrough follow-up (resolve new melees)
7- Breakthrough results per 6
8- Other movement
9- Other fire
10- Morale check
11- Morale reaction (retire, retreat, rout, follow-up)

Miniatures: 2mm to 25mm
Players will need a tape measure, D6, pen and paper

– extract from rulebook

Name: Bloodline
Description:
A chess-like game wherein armies of magical creatures battle to control the kingdom. Each player gets a king, queen, prince, princess, 8 peasants, and two each of dragons, knights, priests, guards, assassins, and witches. The board features secret passageways and obstacles, and bonuses for both the strongest and weakest player.

Goal: to kill off opponents' royal family, or, if players only have three pieces left, to have the higher score (determined by the value of the pieces one has captured).

Name: Anastasia Adventure Game
Description:
Travel around the board, and try to find the Locket, the Royal Crown and the Music box discs to put on your passport. Avoid the evil forces of Rasputin and the Minions, or they’ll take one of your discs!

Be the first to get all three discs and move HOME, and you will prove that Anya is really Anastasia, Princess of Imperial Russia!

Name: Paradise-Opoly
Description:
Paradise-Opoly is a nostalgic and detailed memoir of the small mountain town of Paradise, CA that was devastated by wildfire in 2018. The games base mode uses classic monopoly mechanics and is completely redesigned and re-themed around Paradise culture, history and community. The process of whittling down what would be represented from the town involved hundreds of community members suggesting and voting online what should be included. The result is a rich and well-rounded portrayal of our little town. My main purpose in the design of the game was for it to really give someone that feeling of home when they play it, whether you are from there or not. Nearly every person who was in Paradise that day lost everything. Not only their homes, pets and even family members, but they lost their community. The town was completely changed forever in a matter of hours. My intent is to capture the spirit of Paradise that so many love, cherish and miss dearly.

I am not a game developer, by any means. I just had an idea, shortly after the fire, to create this game to commemorate the town. Since that idea I have learned many things and the idea has grown into a beautifully designed and well thought out game. I am currently in the middle of a Kickstarter campaign and fully expect to reach my funding goal so I can produce 3000 games. 100% of the net-profits from my company sales of the games and merchandise will be donated back to non-profits aimed at immediate rebuilding projects for lower income residents of Paradise. I intend to represent my town and help in any way I can.

The game features fun, vibrant and colorful artwork and design by Traci Van Wagoner and Kurt Keller of Imagine That! Design in New York. They have done an amazing job with conveying the detail and nuance I wanted in every illustration and design. All of the metal game miniatures are custom designed by the very talented 3D sculptor, Chad Hoverter, and represent somethng special and unique to Paradise. Even the old "houses and hotels" are now Miner's Tents and Log Cabins, one of the many references to the very prominent gold rush history of the area. All of the "Property" cards contain a short story or description about the landmark or place they contain. Included is a full color information booklet with extended versions of the stories. For some playing that weren't locals or for kids who may not know all the history of their town the game serves as a fun learning experience of the towns culture and beginnings.

—description from the designer

Name: Absolute Emperor: Napoleonic Wargame Battles
Description:
From the late Revolutionary Wars and Egyptian campaign, to the battles of Austerlitz, Borodino, Leipzig, and Waterloo, Absolute Emperor is a mass battle wargame that provides all the rules needed to play during this period of grand armies and sweeping campaigns.

Players' armies are composed of multiple corps, with command and control being of the utmost importance, all influenced by the elan of your general.

Do you follow in the footsteps of Napoleon and be crowned the Absolute Emperor or stand against tyranny as Wellington and Blücher.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dancing Queen
Description:
Dancing Queen is a 2-player, 9-card game about bringing friends to a dance party. You and your opponent both have in mind a particular dance to perform. Will you get your way? How many boys and girls should you bring? Will you bring a girl secretly dressed up as a boy to foil your opponent's plans?

Both players start with a secret goal, and need to manipulate the gender mix in play to fulfil their goals. There are opportunities to swap your secret goal and to change the gender of a dancer. When a round ends, you reveal your goals to compare who has done better. There are instant-win conditions on some cards. If you manage to achieve these feats, you win a round immediately.

This short and tricky card game features bluffing, setting traps, pushing your luck and reading your opponent.

—description from the designer

2021 BGG 9-Card Nanogame Print-and-Play Design Contest Best Overall Game
2021 BGG 9-Card Nanogame Print-and-Play Design Contest Best 2-player Game
2021 BGG 9-Card Nanogame Print-and-Play Design Contest Best New Designer
2021 BGG 9-Card Nanogame Print-and-Play Design Contest Best Rule Book

Name: You Decide: The Financial Education Game
Description:
Your family has come together to plan their finances. You already know your current situation and what your financial goal is, but… How will you reach that goal? What will your strategy be?

In “You Decide” (Tú Decides) the players adopt the role of a family that seeks to fulfill its great financial goal, while worrying about the income, expenses, debts and contingencies of each month. Each family has an economic situation that must improve, for this they make financial planning decisions and each month they can choose which aspect of their family finances they give special care to. The family first to achieve its great financial goal wins the game.

This game was developed for the financial education department of the Solidarity and Social Investment Fund (FOSIS) of the Ministry of Social Development of the Government of Chile, to be used in training for heads of household in all regions of the country.
More than 4000 units have been distributed and it is in its third edition. Apart from head of household training, It has been distributed and applied to schools throughout Chile and has been successfully received by teachers and students. National tournaments have also been held.

—description from the publisher

Name: Save Now
Description:
Save now (original title "Ahorra es Cuando")

You are part of a group of friends. You all have different interests, but, in turn, you have something in common: you want to have fun, do activities and buy the things you want. To achieve your goals, you must earn money, save, and learn about yout rights. But be careful! You could find advertising or tempting offers that make you spend impulsively, going out of budget or buying things that you do not really need or that do not meet your expectations.

In Save Now you will assume the role of a young man or woman, seeking to achieve your savings goals. In each round of the game you must plan your activities and manage your budget, making decisions that allow you to earn money and save or spend it. Doing the things you love and meeting your savings goals will earn you victory points to win the game.

Save Now is a Financial Education game developed for the National Costumers Service of Chile (SERNAC), aimed at high school youth from all over Chile with the aim of encouraging savings and responsible consumption practices.

Through this material, young players will apply concepts such as planning and budgeting, managing their income based on one or more savings goals. In this way, the game allows to consolidate financial knowledge acquired in various training instances and to understand saving as a fundamental habit in the development of healthy consumption behaviors in the face of current market conditions.

—description from the designer

Name: Learn with Eddu
Description:
What can I spend my money on? How should I invest to increase my income? How much can I spend from my salary? How can I manage my money in the best way?

When it comes time to manage the money that you have every month, many questions arise. But here is Eddu with his advice to give you a little help to take care of your money now and in the future.

Learn with Eddu is a board game whose objective is to give basic notions of the administration of personal finances to young people of school age, as well as to initiate conversations that clarify the doubts on these subjects.

Eddu's game is an initiative of “Falabella Financiero”, and is part of its Financial Education Program that develops various activities, including educational interventions for young people between 12 and 15 years old whose objective is to improve the basic skills of the notion and administration of the money.

—description from the designer

Name: Blood Bowl: Second Season Edition – Chaos Chosen Team Card Pack
Description:
Redesigned for the Second Season ruleset, this deck of 44 cards will help you keep track of stats and profiles for your team, positions, and Star Players – plus Special Play cards exclusively for use with Chaos Chosen teams.


     5 Player Reference cards for Beastman Runner Linemen, Chosen Blockers, Chaos Trolls, Chaos Ogres and Minotaurs
     2 Star Player cards for Morg 'n' Thorg and Lord Borak the Despoiler
     8 Random Event Special Play cards
     8 Miscellaneous Mayhem Special Play cards
     20 Blank Player cards: 13x Beastman Runner Lineman, 4x Chosen Blocker, 1x Chaos Troll, 1x Chaos Ogre, and 1x Minotaur
     The all-important card explaining how to use the other cards, with a red card on the reverse


–description from the publisher

Name: Epic Spell Wars of the Battle Wizards: Annihilageddon – Gang Bangers Expansion
Description:
This is the first expansion for Epic Spell Wars of the Battle Wizards: Annihilageddon. Players can now be in charge of one of five gangs, like the  aggressive and straightforward Merkin, or the more controlling and in-depth Kthulhu Kids. They have to meet their Gang's requirements by buying certain card types or inflicting damage on their opponents, and then, players can recruit Gangsters from their hideout to bolster their builds. Also, the expansion replaces the original 12 Legends from Annihilageddon with 30 new Legendary Treasure cards.

—description from the publihser
Families: Game: Epic Spell Wars of the Battle Wizards

Name: Das Weinstraßen Spiel
Description:
This promotional game for the German Weinstrasse region is structured like Monopoly, but without the game element of investing in houses and hotels. Increases in value result from 6 share cards per business colour, each of which can be bought at a fixed price. Some of the event cards (profits and losses are possible) are directly related to all business colours.

—user summary

Name: Obolus
Description:
The players roll the number- and color-die and set a game token on the corresponding space of the game board. If the space is already occupied the player pays a coin into the cash bowl.

The game ends when a player sets a token onto the last free space of any color. This player wins the game and the contents of the cash bowl.

—user summary

Name: Monopoly: Schwäbisch Hall
Description: The famous Monopoly now themed around Schwäbisch Hall in southwest Germany. Monopoly game play, only the theme - like all themed Monopoly versions - resembles the city.

Name: The Long Way Home
Description:
The Long Way Home is an historical Print & Play solitaire board game based on the true story non-fiction book with the same title. The player must fly their Pan American Clipper the long way home from New Zealand on a westward route due to the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor on Dec. 7, 1941. Along the way, the player will face fuel problems and other difficulties on their journey home due to being out of the Pan American support network for more than half of the trip.

Game components include navigation mats, calendar mat, a tables book, and a counter sheet with various counters to location and status of the Clipper along it's route.

The player moves his Clipper aircraft game counter across the various navigation mats during his journey.

The ultimate goal of the game is to safely fly the Clipper back to the United States before February 1, 1942. Will you succeed?

—description from the designer

Name: Sockenmonster
Description:
This version of Sock Monsters does not have the legacy component, just a mini-expansion with three additional pieces.

While the house is empty, brave and industrious elves set out to tidy up. But the sock monsters are always lurking in the dark! Search chests and lockers, find socks and be the first to collect three pairs. Monsters are eager to steal lone socks. Watch out or, better yet, unleash them on your opponents.

Your game character is a brave and industrious elf trying to rescue socks from sock monsters. You start at the center of the game board, while monsters move from the corners in. Players make moves as monsters first. The monsters lurk around the house, always eager to steal a lone sock from a careless elf and carry it into a dark corner.

The next player to make a move takes a color die and puts it underneath his or her monster figure. When making a move, the players lift the figures slightly above the board, so the die underneath moves with the figure but is not visible from the outside. After making the move, the monster figure can be lifted to see the die. If the top face is showing a closed eye picture, this means the monster has fallen asleep and the player’s turn is over. If the die is showing an open eye picture, the player can perform an action.

After finishing the monster turn, the players then take a turn as elves, trying to find colored socks in chests and cabinets on the game board. If a matching pair of socks is collected, elves put them on their hands, feet and ears – and that’s really hard work!

The game ends when any one player has collected three pairs of socks.

—description from the publisher

Name: Don't Be Stupid!
Description:
You put the cards, hourglass and coins on the table. You then divide into teams of any size or type.

The starting  player then draws a card and asks the question on the card to everyone. The first team to answer correctly wins the card and all braggin' rights associated with winning the card. BUT you can use whatever means to figure out the answer. Google it, Bing it (Is that still a thing?), Call a friend, etc. You can do anything to find the answer.

After answering the question for the team, it is now time for the individual team members to show their skills and win the debate round.

The individual winner (as decided by popular vote) of the debate round gets one of those shiny gold coins.

Play a few rounds and then announce the team winner and the overall individual winner. 
OR...
You can just throw out the rules and play the game with your own house rules.

—description from the designer

Name: Navy Battle Card Game
Description:
A trick-taking card game with cards featuring photos of contemporary United States Navy aircraft, surface ships, and submarines.

The cards are marked with letters from A to Z and some of the cards are numbered as well (i.e. A1, A2, A3, A4). At the start of the game, each player is dealt seven cards. The goal is to capture the most Navy equipment by winning tricks. The highest card played wins the trick, with A being the highest and Z being the lowest. In addition, among the numbered cards with the same letter, the highest number wins (so B4 beats B2).

At the end of the game a player receives 10 points for each card having a number and 5 points for each card that only has a letter. A player can score a bonus 100 points during the game if the cards in the player's hand spell out N-A-V-Y, J-E-T, or S-H-I-P. The first player to reach 1000 points wins the game.

The contents include the rules folder, 54 cards, a score pad, and a small cardboard box-insert tray. The rules folder provides a description of each photo used on the cards.

—user summary

Name: Termite Towers
Description:
Termite Towers is the next insect-forward offering in the line after Waggle Dance. Termite Towers brings players into the world of the efficient and dedicated termites, building on the mechanics of Waggle Dance.

Players compete to complete their section of the mound first, gathering the necessary resources from the wood pile, whilst hatching new termites and training up soldiers that can help you secure the best spots.

With the wood you have gathered, you use the polyomino plan cards to construct your tower, the winner is the first player to build the required number of rows (5 for a shorter game, 7 for a longer game).

Much like its predecessor, you can also call on the help of the Queen to help you, or hinder your opponents.

—description from the designer

Name: The Fifty Game
Description:
Players take turns placing pegs on a 50-hole track. At the start of each game, Player A chooses a range of number provided at the top corner of the board. Player B then moves his peg by any number of holes inside the chosen range. Player A then does the same but starting from the position of Player B's peg. First to reach the 50th hole wins.

—user summary

Name: The Warriors of Athena
Description: The Warriors of Athena is a solo skirmish game set in the world of Greek mythology. The player creates a hero, recruits a warband to accompany and fight alongside them, and then sets out on quests given to them by the goddess Athena. It uses a variant of the Frostgrave rules set. It was featured in two issues of Wargames, Soldiers & Strategy magazine, and then later collected in Spellcaster # 6.

Name: The Smiley Face Game
Description:
Three games in one packaged in a wooden box.

1. The Smiley Face Game 
Players roll dice and race through a 9x9 square grid collecting smiley face disks. The disks are placed at random with the exception of the triple smiley face which is placed at the last space (no. 81). Landing on a space occupied by another player pushes a piece back to the next available unoccupied space. Players collect smiley face disks if they land on a space occupied by a disk. If a smiley face is passed by all players, that disk is placed on the highest available number on the board. Landing on a smiley face disk gives another turn; landing on a double smiley face gives two extra turns. The game ends when a player lands with an exact roll on the last space (no. 81). The player with the most smiley faces at the end wins the game.

2. The Smiley Face Game with no dice
Setup is the same as the first game. Players do not move according to dice rolls but according to a chosen number between 1-5.

3. Odd Even Tag
The game board is a hexagonal ring formed by smaller hexagons. Players choose to play as even or odd. Player take turns rolling dice and the player counters are moved according to the number of dice rolled and if it's odd or even.  The first player to tag the other wins.

—user summary

Name: Under Falling Skies: Cullompton City promo tile
Description:
Additional city tile released as a Gaming Rules! promo.
				
				
					Cullompton (D/G)Blue side (research 5)

"You have 2 discovery tokens.  When you research, you may use up a token and cover one space on the track instead of moving your marker. The space must not cost more than the value of the research effect. Covered spaces are ignored. The top space cannot be covered."

Red side (research 5)

"You have 6 discovery tokens. When you research, you may use up a token and cover one space on the track instead of moving your marker. The space must not cost more than the value of the research effect. Covered spaces are ignored. The top space cannot be covered."

Name: 45 Game and Factors Game
Description:
Two games in a wooden box

1. Factors Game
The playing board is a grid of hexagons with number on each space. Players take turns throwing a dice and moving their markers to an adjacent space that is a multiple of the number on the dice. First to reach the finish wins.

2. 45 Game
The board is similar to the one used in the Factors Game except the numbers on each space are different. Players add the number shown on the dice to the number their markers are on. If the sum is a number which is adjacent to the space they're on, they can move to that new space. First to reach the top (45) is the winner.

—user summary

Name: Neuroshima Hex! 3.0: Monolity
Description:
This mini-add-on introduces Monoliths known from the Monolith Arena game to the world of Neuroshima Hex.

Each player will design and prepare their Monolith before the game, placing their HQ and any two of their Board Tokens on its floors. During gameplay, the Monolith will expand and move repeatedly, and through the skillful use of its hidden tokens, it is capable of tipping the balance of victory in an instant. Thanks to Monoliths your favorite tokens will be available to you from the very beginning of the game, you will be able to plan your strategy more easily and surprise your opponent with your idea of the game.
